text: "Der er et yndigt land" (, meaning "There is a Lovely Land") is one of the two national anthem of Denmark. The melody of this song was created by Hans Ernst Kr칮yer in 1835, and the words of the song were written by Adam Oehlenschl칛ger in 1819. Denmark has another national anthem called "Kong Christian stod ved h칮jen mast," which is usually used for royal and military purposes.http://denmark.dk/en/quick-facts/national-anthems/ Not one but two national anthems. Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Denmark. Retrieved 19 May 2014.https://www.retsinformation.dk/forms/R0710.aspx?id=22926 Udenrigsministeriet, 6 August 2001. Instruks for Udenrigstjenesten. Retsinformation. Retrieved 30 June 2013. ==Lyrics== Words of the song in Danish Pronunciation of these words using the IPA Words of the song in English Der er et yndigt land, Det st친r med brede b칮ge 洧 N칝r salten 칮sterstrand. 洧 Det bugter sig i bakke, dal, Det hedder gamle Danmark 洧 Og det er Frejas sal. 洧 Der sad i fordums tid De harniskkl칝dte k칝mper, 洧 Udhvilede fra strid. 洧 S친 drog de frem til fjenders m칠n, Nu hvile deres bene 洧 Bag h칮jens bautasten. 洧 Det land endnu er sk칮nt, Thi bl친 sig s칮en b칝lter, 洧 Og l칮vet st친r s친 gr칮nt. 洧 Og 칝dle kvinder, sk칮nne m칮er Og m칝nd og raske svende 洧 Bebo de danskes 칮er. 洧 Hil drot og f칝dreland! Hil hver en danneborger, 洧 Som virker, hvad han kan! 洧 Vort gamle Danmark skal best친, S친 l칝nge b칮gen spejler 洧 Sin top i b칮lgen bl친.Der er et Yndigt Land af Adam Oehlenschl칛ger, 1819. danmarkshistoriendk. 洧 [t톝톓퍒 톝톓퍒 e퍃t 틛칮n.tit l칝n] [te퍃 틛st뉆 me칧 틛p투e틣.칧톛 틛p칮틣.j톛] 洧 [n톝톓퍒 틛s칝l.t톛n 틛칮s.t톓.틟st투톔n] 洧 [te퍃 틛p톖k.t톓 s톔j i 틛p톔.k톛 t톝l] [te퍃 틛he퍃.칧톓 틛k톔m.l톛 틛t칝n.m톔k] 洧 [툷 te퍃 톝톓퍒 틛f투톔.j칝s s톝l] 洧 [t톝톓퍒 s칝칧 i 틛f뉆.t톖ms ts퉗i칧] [ti 틛h톔틣.nisk.틟k퉗le.t톛 틛k퉗em.p톓] 洧 [틛u칧.틟vi.l톛.칧톛 f투톔 st투i칧] 洧 [s툷 t투o ti f투칝m ts퉗e퍃l 틛fje.n톓s me퍃n] [nu 틛vi틣.l톛 틛t톝톓퍒.톓s 틛pe퍃틣.n톛] 洧 [p톝j 틛h툷.j톛ns 틛p톔w.t칝.틟ste퍃n] 洧 [te퍃 l칝n e.틛nu 톝톓퍒 sk콉nt] [ts퉗i pl톖 s톔j s칮.j톛n 틛pel.t톓] 洧 [툷(w) 틛l칮.v톛칧 st뉆 s툷 k투톴nt] 洧 [툷(w) 틛톝칧.l톛 틛kve퍃.n톓 sk콉.n톛 m칮톓] [툷(w) men 툷(w) 틛투톔s.k톛 틛sve.n톛] 洧 [pe퍃.틛po ti 틛t칝ns.k톛s 칮톓] 洧 [hil t투툷t 툷(w) 틛fe칧.투톓.틟l칝n] [hil v톝톓퍒 e퍃n 틛t칝.n톛.틟p뉆.w톓] 洧 [s툷m 틛vi톓퍒.k톓 v칝칧 h칝n k퉗칝n] 洧 [v뉆낪 틛k톔m.l톛 틛t칝n.m톔k 틛sk칝l pe퍃.틛st톖] [s툷 틛le.콂톛 틛p칮틣.j톛n 틛sp톔j.l톓] 洧 [sin ts퉗툷p i 틛p칮l.j톛n pl톖] 洧 There is a land we love with shady beech-trees aspread 洧 The briny shores above. 洧 Its hills and valleys gently fall, 'Tis the name of ol' Denmark, 洧 'Tis good ol' Freya's hall. 洧 There in the days of yore Sat armoured giants rested 洧 'Tween their frays of gore 洧 Then they went forth the foe to face, Now found in stone-set barrows, 洧 Their final resting place. 洧 This land is still as fair, The sea is blue around it, 洧 And peace is cherished there. 洧 Strong men and noble women still Uphold their country's honour 洧 With faithfulness and skill. 洧 Hail king and fatherland! Hail citizens of honour, 洧 Who do the best they can. 洧 Our ancient Denmark shall remain, As long as beech tops mirror 洧 In waves of blue their chain! 洧 ==References== Category:National anthems Category:Danish anthems Category:National symbols of Denmark
